parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Insufficient Heat Shielding on Exhaust System
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The inadequate heat shielding on the exhaust system can cause severe burns to the rider's legs, potentially leading to infections and other serious injuries.
symptoms: Riders experience second-degree burns on their legs when contacting the exhaust pipe juncture
even when wearing protective gear such as ankle-high leather boots. The heat shield provided by Harley-Davidson is insufficient
and the exhaust pipe can reach temperatures of up to 1600-1800 degrees.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Excessive engine heat can cause burns to the rider, damage to clothing, and potentially lead to loss of vehicle control, resulting in accidents and injuries.
symptoms: Engine oil temperatures reach up to 300 degrees
and infrared temperature readings on the rider's pant leg can reach 140 degrees. Riders may experience burns
and the heat can cause misfires
leading to loss of vehicle control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS system can cause the brakes to malfunction, leading to loss of control, accidents, or injuries.
symptoms: The ABS system activates unnecessarily
causing the brakes to fail
the rear brake pedal does not respond
the motorcycle "free wheels" when braking
the brakes do not engage even when the pedal is fully depressed.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear brakes can cause the motorcycle to lose stopping power, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The rear brakes do not properly stop the motorcycle
the rear brake pads wear out prematurely
the rear brakes do not lock up even when the pedal is fully depressed.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Inadequate braking power can cause the motorcycle to lose control, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The rear brakes lack adequate stopping power
the motorcycle is difficult to stop
the rear brakes do not respond as expected.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A faulty fuel gauge can lead to the rider being unaware of the actual fuel level, potentially causing the bike to run out of fuel, leaving the rider stranded, and potentially causing accidents.
symptoms: The fuel gauge does not display the correct fuel level
the fuel gauge does not move
the fuel gauge is stuck on a specific level.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The throttle sensor and ECM issues can cause the bike to accelerate on its own, leading to loss of control, accidents, and potentially serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The bike accelerates on its own
the bike sets twist grip codes P2127 and 2138
the check engine light is illuminated
the bike has a slight or hard acceleration without input from the rider.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The cupping of the Dunlop 407F tires can cause vibration at highway speeds and noise while cornering, leading to a potentially dangerous situation, especially during lane changes or cornering.
symptoms: Uneven tire tread cupping
vibration during cornering and lane changes
abnormal wear on the bold angled lateral grooves
unevenly worn areas near the bottom of the lateral grooves on the leading edge
cupping on one side of the tire
and normal wear on the center of the tread.
